text: well uh it's really looking at uh
ethical issues related to anything
related to biom Medicine uh so as I've
said uh issues like how do you manage
with scarce medical resources in the
case of pandemic flu but it also applies
to organ for transplant what are the
principles we use to allocate that those
uh scarce items uh how do we think about
prioritizing uh so it's really thinking
about the values that underly decisions
how you weigh competing values um how do
you justify them that is how do you give
people reasons so that they ought to
agree uh so one of the things which I
like about it is it tends to be somewhat
theoretical you deal with abstract
values but it's also practical you have
to know what's going on in the world you
have to know what the real life problems
are you have to know what are practical
solutions that you can actually
implement
I think one of the big struggles is try
to get complicated issues clear and to
uh both clear in my mind uh and then
clearly expressed and communicated to
other people so let's take this issue of
uh how to allocate scarce resources like
organs or if we had a pandemic flu um
vaccines what are the values at stake
well one of the things I can tell you a
pretty definitive conclusion is there's
not a single value that is going to
determine how you allocate these things
there are going to be multiple values
well one of the challenges is how do you
then balance multiple values um and how
do you articulate how you're balancing
them and why other people should see it
the same way that is a very challenging
thing
bioethics uh I would say there actually
uh there are problems which need to be
addressed but I also think there's a
sort of Manpower problem uh we do not
have a very good Training Program in
this country uh for bioethics we don't
support it actually despite the fact
that it occupies a lot of media
attention despite the fact that everyone
says how important it is you always hear
this phrase our technolog is outrunning
our values and our bioethical
understanding and yet we have a very
poor way of actually uh supporting it
over the long run so people can take
time and address big problems uh and
think for uh a while on some of these
problems as I mentioned some of the
issues that we address we can be sure
that it's going to take us two years to
think through some of this stuff um and
uh we don't have a mechanism to really
support that and one of the consequences
of that is we have not been good at
training young people to come through
and to attract some of the smartest
young people into the field and I think
that's a huge huge issue obviously there
are lots of particular issues that we
need to address uh better but I think if
we had uh uh a lot more smart people in
the field with a lot more sustained
support
uh those issues could be well addressed
